page.title: 07Housing in Dean
page.content: As most of Upper Dean is a conservation area care has had to be taken in any new development and redevelopment to ensure that such building does not introduce a suburban influence into the area and in fact makes a positive contribution to the character of the village. So it is ensured that new houses are appropriate in terms of siting, design and materials used. New properties have been built by the Brook at the Yelden end of the village, on the road down to the ford and adjacent to the Chapel. There is a larger proportion of new buildings in Lower Dean, though they are mainly designed to blend with the surroundings, with much use of wood. The old pub is now a house and 2 barns have been converted to bungalows. There is also a new Roman Villa.
